meanings.definition: A horse race for three-year-old horses.
meanings.sent1: The derby was won by a fast three-year-old horse.
meanings.sent2: Many people gathered to watch the exciting derby race.
meanings.sent3: The three-year-old horse decided to enter the derby for some fun.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was in a derby, racing against time to finish her work.
meanings.sent5: The derby was a thrilling event with horses galloping at top speed.

meanings.definition: A race or contest open to all comers or to a specific category of contestants.
meanings.sent1: The local derby welcomed participants of all ages.
meanings.sent2: She trained hard to compete in the upcoming derby.
meanings.sent3: The derby for the best pie baker in town was a fierce competition.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, every day feels like a derby to stay ahead of the competition.
meanings.sent5: Joining the derby was a great opportunity to showcase her skills.

meanings.definition: A stiff felt hat with a rounded crown and narrow brim.
meanings.sent1: He tipped his derby hat as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent2: The detective wore a classic derby hat during the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his derby hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a character from the past wearing a derby hat.
meanings.sent5: The derby hat completed his vintage look for the themed party.
